channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Weyl's Quantifiers
item.description: arXiv:2408.08562v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Weyl's interpretation of quantified formulas should not be conflated with Hilbert's. His semantic reasons for rejecting the law of excluded middle are based on a normative conception of transfinite mathematics as a system of conditional obligations.
item.dc:creator: Iulian D. Toader

item.title: Polyhedral products and features of their homotopy theory
item.description: arXiv:1903.04114v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: A polyhedral product is a natural subspace of a Cartesian product that is specified by a simplicial complex. The modern formalism arose as a generalization of the spaces known as moment-angle complexes which were developed within the nascent subject of toric topology. This field, which began as a topological approach to toric geometry and aspects of symplectic geometry, has expanded rapidly in recent years. The investigation of polyhedral products and their homotopy theoretic properties has developed to the point where they are studied in various fields of mathematics far removed from their origin. In this survey, we provide a brief historical overview of the development of this subject, summarize many of the main results and describe applications.
item.dc:creator: A. Bahri, M. Bendersky, F. R. Cohen
